channel.title: hacking on A haven for Unix & Linux deviants
channel.description: Recent content in hacking on A haven for Unix & Linux deviants

item.title: The Max Headroom Pirating Incident
item.description: Really interesting Documentary on the incident. Kind of makes you think about that struggle between Broadcasting Companies, and the Jackers who wanted to take over their airwaves. I would assume that this trick is still possible in 3rd-World countries where the Media does not have the $$$ like US Broadcasters. Plus… Max Headroom was an awesome show! I miss a lot of the older/weirder shows from my youth.

item.title: The Binchotan Stove
item.description: Really cool stuff. I will have to try and make one of these. Binchotan is really expensive in this part of the country though!!

item.title: Auditor
The Darknet Project
item.description: Those Guys over at Team Cymru Research have done it again! They have released a new version of their Darknet Project. For those unaware of what this is… check it out! Tracking compromised machines can be difficult. Security solutions often don’t scale to the size of larger networks. Technologies such as IDS are flawed, producing copious false positives. When solutions are scaled to fit the larger providers, they often require considerable care and feeding, thus taking time away from problem mitigation.
